what-it-does: Checks for mutations to an iterable during a loop iteration.
why-is-this-bad:
When iterating over an iterable, mutating the iterable can lead to unexpected
behavior, like skipping elements or infinite loops.
example:
items = [1, 2, 3]

for item in items:
    print(item)

    # Create an infinite loop by appending to the list.
    items.append(item)

example-split.example-before:
items = [1, 2, 3]

for item in items:
    print(item)

    # Create an infinite loop by appending to the list.
    items.append(item)
